results.title: Adoption: children are waiting
results.creator_credit: Laurie Jennings, Lee Gordon, National Film Board of Canada and Westminster Films
results.brief_description: This film will inform and encourage prospective adopting parents and be helpful to professionals in the child-welfare field. In interviews, three couples relate their experiences of adopting older or handicapped children. A fourth couple explains how they, as foster parents, try to prepare children emotionally for adoption.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Laurie Jennings, Lee Gordon, National Film Board of Canada and Westminster Films

results.title: ADHA: attention deficit hyperactivity disorder
results.brief_description: Dr. Christopher Green, author of the famous “Toddler taming” and “Babies”, is a leading authority on Attention Deficit Disorder. This program, designed for parents, teachers and healthcare professionals, investigates key issues about the disorder. It examines ADHD in the under 5’s, school age children, and adults, as well as covering diagnosis, behaviour techniques, alternative treatment and medication.

results.title: Actualization through assertion
results.creator_credit: Barnett Addis, Larry King, Robert Liberman and Research Press
results.brief_description: Four clients are seen in group assertion training, developing a style by practicing appropriate eye contact, gestures, body movement, touch, facial expression, voice tone and volume. Therapists are seen directing the client’s progress and reinforcing small successes. Practice assignments are given in which newly learned skills are applid to situations in client’s daily lives.

results.title: Action: the October crisis of 1970
results.creator_credit: Robin Spry, Normand Cloutier, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A long and thoughtful look at those desperate days of October 1970, when Montreal awaited the outcome of FLQ terrorist acts. This film puts the October Crisis in the long perspective of history. Compiled from news and other films, it shows independence movements past and present, and their leaders; it reflects the mingled relief, dismay, defiance, when the Canadian army came to Montreal; and it shows how political leaders viewed the intervention. Edited by Shelagh Mackenzie adn Joan Henson. Sound by Bernie Bordeleau. (Awards: Nyon, Chicago, Niagara-on-the Lake)

results.title: Across the Sea of Galilee
results.brief_description: Filmed on the eve of the historic Arafat Peace Agreement and records the daily lives and views of Jews, Palestinians and Christians. We learn how they perceive their country during this time of change, how they deal with constant war and the conflicts of the different religions in the Middle East. We are taken on a series of adventures; camel riding across the Negev Desert to meet nomadic Bedouin tribesman, kibbutz living on a Lebanon border and driving tanks in the Golan Heights. We also see female soldiers on the Syrian border, a Jewish wedding and the ultra-orthodox Jews of Mea Shearim who dress in 18th Centruy styles from Eastern Europe.

results.title: Aclà
results.creator_credit: Aurelio Grimaldi, Camilla Nesbitt, Pietro Valsecchi, CineEuropa '92, Nova Films and Pentafilm
results.brief_description: In the 1930s and 11-year-old Sicilian boy, Acla, is sold to a sulphur miner, and for five years from Monday to Saturday, the boy is made the miner’s property, spending the whole week down the mine, going home on Saturday and Sunday. There he experiences the inhuman world of the sulphur mines, the stifling, choking tunnels and the physical and sexual violence that everybody indulges in by unspoked agreement. He attempts several escapes, but each time he is caught and beaten. Until the last attempt, when finally he reaches the sea. And freedom… In Italian language with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Aurelio Grimaldi, Camilla Nesbitt, Pietro Valsecchi, CineEuropa ‘92, Nova Films and Pentafilm

results.title: Acid from heaven
results.creator_credit: George Mully and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Many years ago there was a popular song suggesting that each time it rained it rained pennies from heaven. Today’s reality is that when it rains, it rains acid from heaven. By re-enacting a case study of a person whose income was cut off as a direct result of acid rain, this presentation, composed of still photo montage, provides in laymen’s terms some basic information about this little-known form of pollution.

results.title: Accidents don't happen. Ch. 5: safe clothing
results.creator_credit: David Bairstow, Donald Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Brogan thinks Foreman McCardle has gone clean off his rocker when he has him, Brogan, carted away to the clinic although he’s perfectly well. When Nurse Gilfillan starts to operate - on Brogan’s trailing necktie, baggy-sleeved sweater, cuffed pants and worn-out shoes - horrid tales of workers who had worn similar clothing and been reduced to near-hamburger make everything quite clear. Cast: Joseph Carr, Marcia Diamond, Alfie Scopp
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Bairstow, Donald Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Accidents don't happen. Ch. 4: falls
results.creator_credit: Donald Mulholland, Fred Lasse and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Spotlights the most common causes of serious falls in industry. While an ironic commentary suggests new and better ways of tripping people up, we see workers drop truck handles in the aisles, neglect loose floor boards, leave pails on stairs, climb on rickety boxes, and use an extension ladder without safety feet. The film ends with practical advice on how to eliminate factory danger spots that may result in bad falls.

results.title: Accident
results.creator_credit: Martin Duckworth, Pat Crawley, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The subject is the actual crash of a small plane in which one man survived to tell the story. What he describes is his view of the world now, after being on the edge of death. It is, he says, like being continually stoned - neutral but more fully aware, accepting life without bias, a condition he feels we are all coming to. Award: New York.
